name: Treacle (Blackstrap Molasses)
properties: Thick, dark syrup byproduct of sugar refining
Blackstrap treacle/molasses is the most nutritious type (third boiling)
Rich in iron, calcium, magnesium, and potassium
Contains B vitamins, particularly vitamin B6
Provides trace minerals including copper and manganese
Has a strong, distinctive bitter-sweet flavor
Less sweet than refined sugar, more complex flavor
Lower glycemic impact than refined sugars
benefits: Excellent plant-based source of iron for preventing anemia
Supports bone health with calcium and magnesium
Provides essential minerals often lacking in plant-based diets
May help maintain healthy blood pressure with potassium
Supports energy production through B vitamins
Adds depth and umami to savory dishes
Better nutritional profile than refined sweeteners
synergies: Combines with umami sauce in Asian-inspired dishes
Pairs with rice vinegar in sweet-savory sauces
Works with ginger and garlic in stir-fry marinades
Complements red pepper flakes for sweet-heat balance
conflicts: Use sparingly - still a concentrated sweetener
Strong flavor may overpower delicate dishes
Not suitable for those monitoring iron intake for medical reasons
amount: 1 tablespoon per recipe serving 4 people (use sparingly)
